actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide a more equitable method of determining average monthly wages for purposes of computing disability insurance benefits in the case of certain individuals who qualify for such benefits before attaining age 31.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends Title II (Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to provide that for purposes of determining the average monthly wage of individuals who qualify for disability benefits before attaining age 31, the number of benefit computation years shall be determined according to the formula used to determine the number of such years for old age and survivor's benefit recipients.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide a more equitable method of determining average monthly wages for purposes of computing disability insurance benefits in the case of certain individuals who qualify for such benefits before attaining age 31.
